He managed to annihilate [[Wei Yuanzhong]]'s army in 701 with his brother. He also reconquered [[Basmyl]] tribes in 703. Therefore, sticking to [[Tengrism|Tengriism]] was necessary to survive.''[[Wenxian Tongkao]]'', 2693a''[[New Book of Tang]]'', [https://zh.wikisource.org/wiki/%E6%96%B0%E5%94%90%E6%9B%B8/%E5%8D%B7215%E4%B8%8B vol 215-II] == Later reign == [[File:Bilge_Khagan_monument_Mongolia.JPG|thumb|The BilgÃ¤ Qaghan monument with inscriptions, Mongolia|369x369px]]In 720, Wang believed that the Pugu (åƒ•å›º) and Xiedie tribes of the region were planning to defect to Eastern Tujue and attack with Eastern Tujue troops. He thus held a feast and invited the chieftains, and, at the feast, massacred them. He then attacked the Pugu and Xiedie tribes in the area, nearly wiping them out. He then proposed a plan to attack Qaghan along with the [[Basmyl|Baximi]], [[Kumo Xi|Xi]], and [[Khitan people|Khitan]]. [[Emperor Xuanzong of Tang|Emperor Xuanzong]] also recruited [[Qapaghan Qaghan|Qapaghan Khagan]]'s sons BilgÃ¤ Tigin and Mo Tigin, [[Yenisei Kyrgyz]] Qaghan Kutluk BilgÃ¤ Qaghan and Huoba Guiren to fight against Tujue. [[Tonyukuk]] cunningly launched first attack on Baximi in 721 autumn, completely crushing them. Meanwhile, BilgÃ¤ raided [[Gansu]], taking much of the livestock. Later that year [[Khitan people|Khitan]]s, next year [[Kumo Xi|Xi]] were also crushed. In 726, his father-in-law and chancellor [[Tonyukuk]] died. On 27 February 731, [[Kul Tigin]] died, for which Qaghan mourned and ordered a great funeral ceremony.{{Cite web|url=http://bitig.org/?lang=e&mod=1&tid=1&oid=15&m=1|title=Kultegin's Memorial Complex|last=|first=|date=|website=bitig.org|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2018-07-29}} In 733, he defeated rebellious Khitan tribes. == Death == Just after sending an emissary to [[Emperor Xuanzong of Tang|Xuanzong]] to gain heqin alliance, he was poisoned by Buyruk Chor.[http://mtad.humanity.ankara.edu.tr/IV-3_Eylul2007/240_47_MTAD4-3_EEkrem.pdf Erkin Ekrem, "SarÄ± UygurlarÄ±n KÃ¶keni", ''Modern TÃ¼rklÃ¼k AraÅŸtÄ±rma Dergisi'', Vol. 4, No. 3, 2007, p. 175.] He did not die immediately and he had time to punish the family of Buyruk Chor with death. He died on 25 November 734, his burial ceremony took place on 22 June 735. == Family == He was married to [[Po Beg|El Etmish Bilge Khatun]], [[Tonyukuk]]'s daughter.
